title: Phrack World News
short_summary: This issue of Phrack World News covers various significant events and personalities in the hacking and telecommunications landscape of the late 1980s, including updates on Kevin Mitnick, MCI vs. AT&T lawsuits, and notable hacking incidents.
summary:
In this edition of Phrack World News, Knight Lightning presents a collection of articles that delve into the evolving landscape of hacking and telecommunications during the late 1980s. The issue highlights the legal troubles surrounding infamous hacker Kevin Mitnick, who was involved in stealing a DEC computer security program, and the subsequent plea deal for his accomplice, Leonard Mitchell DiCicco. The article discusses the implications of their actions and the judicial system's response to hacking at the time, showcasing the growing concern over computer crimes.

Additionally, the zine covers the fierce competition between telecommunications giants MCI and AT&T, including MCI's lawsuit against AT&T for deceptive advertising practices. This legal battle reflects the intense rivalry in the long-distance market post-AT&T's breakup, illustrating how advertising and public perception played crucial roles in shaping consumer choices. The issue serves as a snapshot of a pivotal moment in hacker culture and telecommunications history, making it a valuable read for those interested in the roots of modern cybersecurity and corporate competition.
